refnamediv.refpurpose: Checks if the class has been defined

refsect1.title: Description

note.para: The autoload parameter was added in PHP 5

refsect1.para: This function returns &true; if the class given by class_name has been defined, &false; otherwise.
class_exists will attempt to call __autoload by default, if you don't want class_exists to call __autoload(), you can set the paramater autoload to &false;.

example.title: autoload parameter example
example.programlisting:
<?php
    function __autoload($class) {
        include($class . '.php');

        /* Check to see it the include defined the class */
        if ( !class_exists($class, false) ) {
           trigger_error("Unable to load class $class", E_USER_ERROR);
        }
    }
    
    if( class_exists('MyClass') ) {
        $myclass = new MyClass();
    }

?>
